definition[0]: to press something so hard that it breaks or is damaged
example[0]: His leg was crushed in the accident.
example[1]: Two people were crushed to death in the rush to escape.
definition[1]: to press something in order to break it into very small pieces or into a powder
definition[2]: to make someone feel extremely upset or shocked
example[3]: Sara was crushed by their insults.
definition[3]: a crowd of people pressed so close together that it is difficult for them to move
example[4]: There’s always such a crush on the train in the mornings.
definition[4]: a strong feeling of romantic love for someone, especially one that a young person has for someone older who they do not know well
example[5]: She had a huge crush on her geography teacher.
definition[5]: someone who you have a feeling of romantic love for, but who you do not know well
example[7]: a first date with your crush
